  • Method Details

    • initChess

      public static void initChess()
      Initializes the board with the chess pieces in their starting positions.

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard()
      Prints the current state of the chess board. Chess pieces are represented by their symbols, and are preceded by a letter indicating their color. Empty spots on the board are represented by two hash signs (##). If a spot has a chess piece on it, and it is a black piece, it is represented by a 'b' followed by the piece symbol. If a spot has a chess piece on it, and it is a white piece, it is represented by a 'w' followed by the piece symbol. If a spot does not have a chess piece on it, and it is an even numbered row and column, it is represented by three empty spaces. If a spot does not have a chess piece on it, and it is an odd numbered row and column, it is represented by two hash signs.

    • getPiecesOfColor

      public static List<Model.ChessPiece> getPiecesOfColor(String color)
      Returns a list of all chess pieces on the board that belong to the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the pieces to retrieve (either "white" or "black")
      Returns:
      a list of ChessPiece objects that belong to the specified color

    • getValidKingMoves

      public static List<int[]> getValidKingMoves(int kingRow, int kingCol)
      Returns a list of valid moves for a king at the given position on an 8x8 chess board. The method checks all 8 possible moves from the king's position and adds any valid moves to the list of valid moves.
      Parameters:
      kingRow - the row position of the king on the board
      kingCol - the column position of the king on the board
      Returns:
      a list of int arrays representing the row and column positions of the valid moves for the king

    • getAllPiecesOfColor

      public static List<Model.ChessPiece> getAllPiecesOfColor(String color)
      Returns a list of all the chess pieces on the board that have the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the chess pieces to retrieve (either "white" or "black")
      Returns:
      a list of all the chess pieces on the board with the specified color

    • isChecked

      public static boolean isChecked(String color)
      Checks whether a king of the given color is in check.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the king to check for check
      Returns:
      true if the king is in check, false otherwise

    • isCheckmate

      public static boolean isCheckmate(String color)
      Checks if the given color is in checkmate.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to check for checkmate
      Returns:
      true if the given color is in checkmate, false otherwise

    • convertPosition

      public static int[] convertPosition(String position)
      Converts a position in algebraic notation to a corresponding array index on the chessboard. The algebraic notation is assumed to be in the format of a lowercase letter representing the file (column) followed by a digit representing the rank (row). This method returns an int array containing the row and column indices on the chessboard. If the input position is invalid or out of bounds, this method returns {-1, -1}.
      Parameters:
      position - a string representing a chess position in algebraic notation
      Returns:
      anint array containing the row and column indices on the chessboard, or {-1, -1}

    • checkPromote

      public static boolean checkPromote(int toRow, String color)
      Checks if a pawn has reached the opposite end of the board and is eligible for promotion
      Parameters:
      toRow - The row where the pawn has moved to
      color - The color of the pawn
      Returns:
      true if the pawn has reached the opposite end of the board and is eligible for promotion, false otherwise

    • promote

      public static void promote(int fromRow, int fromColumn, String promoteTo)
      Promotes a pawn to a new piece type.
      Parameters:
      fromRow - the row of the pawn to be promoted
      fromColumn - the column of the pawn to be promoted
      promoteTo - the new piece type to promote the pawn to (B, N, Q, or R)

    • isDiagonalMove

      public static boolean isDiagonalMove(int fromRow, int fromColumn, int toRow, int toColumn)
      Determines if a move from the given starting position to the given ending position is a diagonal move for a pawn. A diagonal move is defined as moving exactly one column to the left or right and one row forward (for a white pawn) or backward (for a black pawn).
      Parameters:
      fromRow - the starting row of the move
      fromColumn - the starting column of the move
      toRow - the ending row of the move
      toColumn - the ending column of the move
      Returns:
      true if the move is a diagonal move for a pawn, false otherwise

    • runner1

      public static void runner1()
      This class contains a method that runs a chess game using the console as the user interface. It prompts the user to enter their moves via the console, and validates each move before making it on the board. It also handles pawn promotion, and checking for a draw or resignation. The game continues until a player wins, resigns, or the user enters "draw?".

    • runner2

      public static void runner2(String path, boolean printEveryRound, boolean printAtLast)
      This class provides a chess game runner that reads moves from a file and makes the moves on the chess board. It includes a method to start the runner, and methods to check if a move is valid, if a promotion is valid, and to promote a pawn. The class uses a 2D array to represent the chess board, and has classes to represent each type of chess piece.
      Parameters:
      path - The file path to read moves from.
      printEveryRound - If true, print the board after every move.
      printAtLast - If true, print the final board after all moves.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This is the main method that starts the chess game.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments
